review_en: This is huge! Wilds PC performance has been a pain point for many, so a potential 2x boost just by removing DLC checks is a game-changer. Huge respect to Praydog!
title_en: Monster Hunter Wilds PC Performance Could Double by Removing DLC Checks!
summary_en:
â€¢ PC performance issues with Monster Hunter Wilds persist nearly a year after release.
â€¢ Improvements have been attempted using modder Praydog's REFramework and a texture decompressor tool.
â€¢ Removing DLC checks may significantly boost performance.
content_en:
The PC version of Monster Hunter Wilds has faced performance issues since its launch. Renowned modder Praydog published an updated version of his REFramework shortly after release to address stuttering caused by the game's anti-tampering technology. A texture decompressor tool was also released in April 2025 to minimize stuttering related to real-time in-game texture decompression. While the developer has worked to improve performance, including adding support for NVIDIA DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation and AMD FSR 4, fundamental problems remain. Recent reports suggest that removing DLC checks could potentially double performance, making this a significant development for PC players.

Review (EN)

This is huge! Wilds PC performance has been a pain point for many, so a potential 2x boost just by removing DLC checks is a game-changer. Huge respect to Praydog!

title_en: BREAKING: NVIDIA and Eli Lilly Partner to Establish Joint AI Lab, Investing Up to $1 Billion to Revolutionize Drug Discovery!
summary_en:
â€¢ NVIDIA and Eli Lilly are co-founding an AI lab to pursue next-generation drug discovery leveraging artificial intelligence.
â€¢ The companies will invest up to $1 billion over five years to bolster AI infrastructure and research & development.
â€¢ Utilizing NVIDIAâ€™s BioNeMo platform and Vera Rubin architecture, the lab will employ robotics and physical AI to accelerate the drug discovery process.
content_en:
NVIDIA and Eli Lilly today announced a first-of-its-kind AI co-innovation lab focused on applying AI to tackle some of the most enduring challenges in the pharmaceutical industry. The lab brings together Lillyâ€™s world-leading expertise in discovering, developing and manufacturing medicines with NVIDIAâ€™s leadership in AI, accelerated computing and AI infrastructure. The two companies will invest up to $1 billion in talent, infrastructure and compute over five years to support the new AI co-innovation lab. Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, the lab will co-locate Lilly domain experts in biology, science and medicine with top AI model builders and engineers from NVIDIA, allowing them to work side by side to generate large-scale data and build powerful AI models that can accelerate medicine development, using NVIDIA BioNeMo as the critical platform. The collaboration will initially focus on creating a continuous learning system that tightly connects Lillyâ€™s agentic wet labs with computational dry labs, enabling 24/7 AI-assisted experimentation to support biologists and chemists. This scientist-in-the-loop framework aims to enable experiments, data generation and AI model development to continuously inform and improve one another.

Review (EN)

Whoa! NVIDIA & Lilly teaming up for AI drug discovery? That's HUGE! $1B investment is insane. This could be a total game-changer for pharma! ğŸ”¥

review_en: Absolutely incredible numbers! 28% 3nm revenue share proves TSMC's dominance. The future of chip tech is looking bright!
title_en: TSMC Announces Stellar Q4 2025 Results! Explosive Growth & 3nm Process Tech Takes Center Stage!
summary_en:
â€¢ TSMC's Q4 2025 revenue reached NT$1,046.09 billion, a 20.5% year-over-year increase.
â€¢ Net income rose 35.0% year-over-year to NT$505.74 billion, with EPS at NT$19.50 (US$3.14 per ADR).
â€¢ 3nm process technology accounted for 28% of total wafer revenue, with advanced technologies (7nm and below) representing 77%.
content_en:
TSMC today announced consolidated revenue of NT$1,046.09 billion, net income of NT$505.74 billion, and diluted earnings per share of NT$19.50 (US$3.14 per ADR unit) for the fourth quarter ended December 31, 2025. Year-over-year, fourth quarter revenue increased 20.5% while net income and diluted EPS both increased 35.0%. Compared to third quarter 2025, fourth quarter results represented a 5.7% increase in revenue and an 11.8% increase in net income. All figures were prepared in accordance with TIFRS on a consolidated basis. In US dollars, fourth quarter revenue was $33.73 billion, which increased 25.5% year-over-year and increased 1.9% from the previous quarter. Gross margin for the quarter was 62.3%, operating margin was 54.0%, and net profit margin was 48.3%. In the fourth quarter, shipments of 3-nanometer accounted for 28% of total wafer revenue; 5-nanometer accounted for 35%; 7-nanometer accounted for 14%. Advanced technologies, defined as 7-nanometer and more advanced technologies, accounted for 77% of total wafer revenue. This is a key indicator demonstrating TSMC's technological prowess and market leadership.

Review (EN)

Absolutely incredible numbers! 28% 3nm revenue share proves TSMC's dominance. The future of chip tech is looking bright!

title_en: Rockstar Launches Cfx Marketplace: Official Mod Store for FiveM and RedM, Fueling Creator Economy!
summary_en:
â€¢ Rockstar Games has launched the 'Cfx Marketplace,' an official store for FiveM and RedM mod creators.
â€¢ This allows mod creators to sell their work, establishing a new revenue stream.
â€¢ This move suggests a strong focus on user-generated content in future titles, potentially including Grand Theft Auto VI.
content_en:
Rockstar Games has launched the 'Cfx Marketplace,' a digital storefront dedicated to mods for the FiveM and RedM frameworks used with Grand Theft Auto V and Red Dead Redemption 2. This platform enables creators to monetize their modifications, providing a new avenue for revenue generation. Several creators have already signed up for the marketplace, signaling a vibrant modding community. This announcement underscores Rockstar Games' commitment to user-generated content and hints at potentially expanded mod support in future titles, particularly Grand Theft Auto VI. This development is expected to significantly contribute to the growth of the creator economy within the gaming industry.

Review (EN)

Huge news! Rockstar officially supporting modding with a marketplace is a game-changer. This will unlock incredible creativity and extend the life of their games. Can't wait to see what's next for GTA VI!

review_en: This yield rate and SF2P implementation are incredible! The approaching practical application of the 2nm process holds huge potential for future smartphone and PC performance. Samsung is regaining its tech leadership!
title_en: Samsung Achieves 50% Yield on 2nm GAA Process! Leading the Next-Gen Semiconductor Race with SF2P Technology
summary_en:
â€¢ Samsung has achieved a 50% yield on its 2nm GAA process.
â€¢ Promotion of the next-generation SF2P (second-generation 2nm GAA) technology is beginning.
â€¢ Following the success of the Exynos 2600, development of next-generation node technology is accelerating.
content_en:
Samsung Electronics has announced that it has achieved a 50% yield on its 2nm GAA (Gate-All-Around) process. This represents a significant milestone in the development of next-generation semiconductor technology. Currently, the company is working to improve yields while simultaneously initiating promotion of its second-generation 2nm GAA technology, known as SF2P. SF2P incorporates several improvements over the first-generation 2nm GAA process. Samsung has instructed its Design Solution Partners (DSPs) to prioritize the promotion of SF2P, aiming to enhance its competitiveness in the next-generation semiconductor market. The success of the Exynos 2600 is believed to be accelerating this technological development. This advancement is expected to contribute to higher performance across a wide range of fields, including smartphones and data centers.

Review (EN)

This yield rate and SF2P implementation are incredible! The approaching practical application of the 2nm process holds huge potential for future smartphone and PC performance. Samsung is regaining its tech leadership!

title_en: TSMC CEO Downplays Intel Foundry's Progress, Confident in AI Boom Advantage
summary_en:
â€¢ TSMC CEO C.C. Wei stated he is 'not worried' about the progress of Intel Foundry.
â€¢ TSMC is expanding its share in the foundry market due to increased demand in HPC and AI sectors.
â€¢ The rise of Intel Foundry signals increased competition for TSMC and potential price reductions.
content_en:
TSMC CEO C.C. Wei commented on the progress of Intel Foundry in the semiconductor sector, stating that the company has no particular concerns. TSMC currently dominates the foundry market, further solidifying its position with increasing demand from the HPC (High-Performance Computing) and AI (Artificial Intelligence) sectors. However, TSMC's current production capacity constraints are creating new opportunities for competitors such as Samsung and Intel Foundry. Internal sources suggest that simply investing capital will not be enough for Intel to catch up to TSMC, citing a significant gap in technological capabilities. Nevertheless, increased competition from Intel could lead to price reductions in next-generation products like Ryzen and GeForce, which would be beneficial for consumers.

Review (EN)

TSMC's lead in the AI boom is undeniable. Intel has a mountain to climb, but competition is *always* good for consumers! Hoping for cheaper next-gen CPUs & GPUs.

review_en: Absolutely insane specs! The Zen 5 + 3D V-Cache combo is a game-changer. The MEG X870E UNIFY-X MAX's overclocking & cooling are a dream for enthusiasts. Wi-Fi 7 & 5G LAN? ğŸ”¥
title_en: MSI Announces Next-Gen Motherboards Supporting Ryzen 7 9850X3D - Pushing the Limits of Gaming & Creation!
summary_en:
â€¢ Supports the AMD Ryzen 7 9850X3D processor, leveraging the Zen 5 architecture and 3D V-Cache technology.
â€¢ MSI's flagship model, the 'MEG X870E UNIFY-X MAX', is a high-performance motherboard designed for overclocking enthusiasts.
â€¢ Features Wi-Fi 7 and 5G LAN for fast and stable network connectivity.
content_en:
MSI has announced motherboards supporting the AMD Ryzen 7 9850X3D processor, featuring AMD's next-generation Zen 5 architecture and the latest 3D V-Cache technology. This processor boasts 8 cores, 16 threads, a total of 104MB of cache, a maximum boost clock of 5.60GHz, and a maximum TDP of 120W. It is optimized for high-performance gaming and content creation, and is expected to set a new standard for high-performance computing. Simultaneously announced, the flagship model 'MEG X870E UNIFY-X MAX' is designed for users seeking extreme overclocking, featuring a 2-DIMM layout and an OC engine. A robust 18+2+1 power phase design (110A SPS) combined with an advanced thermal solution featuring Direct Touch Cross Heat-pipe and dual-sided EZ M.2 Shield Frozr II ensures stable operation. Furthermore, the integration of cutting-edge Wi-Fi 7 and 5G LAN delivers peak efficiency for data-intensive applications and low-latency connectivity. A dedicated tuning controller simplifies overclocking adjustments and CMOS clearing.

Review (EN)

Absolutely insane specs! The Zen 5 + 3D V-Cache combo is a game-changer. The MEG X870E UNIFY-X MAX's overclocking & cooling are a dream for enthusiasts. Wi-Fi 7 & 5G LAN? ğŸ”¥

The split spacebar might take getting used to, but the overall customization makes this keyboard incredibly appealing. Group buy, here I come!
title_en: CannonKeys Unveils 'Bullet Train' â€“ 40% Keyboard with Half Tenkey, Compact & High-Performance!
summary_en:
â€¢ CannonKeys has announced the 'Bullet Train,' a uniquely designed mechanical keyboard.
â€¢ It features a 40% layout with a half tenkey, offering both compactness and high usability.
â€¢ Equipped with wired/wireless connectivity, hot-swap support, and an aluminum case, it's ideal for gaming.
content_en:
CannonKeys, known for its uniquely designed mechanical keyboards such as the 'Minimi40' themed around lunchboxes, has announced the 'Bullet Train.' This keyboard inherits the company's design aesthetic while further evolving its functionality. It adopts the 'V4N4G0N' layout, featuring a 40% layout with a half tenkey, effectively utilizing limited space while still providing the convenience of a tenkey. The case is made of aluminum and features a low-profile design, resulting in a stylish appearance. The default plate is made of FR4 to ensure wireless signal integrity, but aluminum and PC plates are also available as options. It supports both wired and wireless connections, with Bluetooth for wireless and QMK firmware for the wired version. Hot-swap support allows for easy replacement of various switches, including Gateron KS-33 (low-profile V2) switches. The typing angle is 0 degrees, and the spacebar features a split design. It is available in five colors: black, dark green, lilac, pink, and silver. Group buy starts on February 5th, with the wired version starting at $170 (approximately Â¥26,860) and the wireless version at $200 (approximately Â¥31,600). Keycaps and switches are sold separately, but CannonKeys is considering offering compatible keycap and switch bundles.

Review (EN)

Seriously impressive specs! A half tenkey on a 40% board is a brilliant idea. The low-profile design and aluminum case are a perfect combo of style and durability. The split spacebar might take getting used to, but the overall customization makes this keyboard incredibly appealing. Group buy, here I come!

review_en: 75% performance boost?! That's HUGE! Capcom needs to address this ASAP. Huge props to the modder!
title_en: Monster Hunter Wild Performance Issues Potentially Linked to DLC Checks! Mod Achieves Up to 75% Improvement!
summary_en:
â€¢ The performance issues plaguing 'Monster Hunter Wild' are suspected to be caused by a process constantly checking for owned DLC content.
â€¢ Accounts with more DLC owned appear to experience less performance degradation.
â€¢ Disabling the DLC check via mod has resulted in up to a 75% performance increase on mid-range PCs.
content_en:
Since its release, 'Monster Hunter Wild' has faced criticism regarding performance and optimization, despite improvements through updates. A recent investigation by Reddit users suggests that the game's process of checking for DLC content ownership may be contributing to performance issues. Testing revealed that Capcom appears to be constantly verifying DLC ownership in the background, potentially impacting performance. Notably, accounts with a larger number of DLC titles owned exhibited less performance degradation. Furthermore, disabling this DLC check using a mod resulted in a significant performance increase of up to 75% on mid-range PCs. Whether this check is intentional or a bug remains unclear, but the lack of a fix in post-launch patches suggests Capcom is likely aware of the issue. Further performance improvements are scheduled for 2026, and users have expressed intent to release the mod if Capcom does not address the problem. This mod could be a game-changer for many players.

Review (EN)

75% performance boost?! That's HUGE! Capcom needs to address this ASAP. Huge props to the modder!

title_en: Schenker Element 16: Ultimate Customization! Next-Gen Gaming PC Revealed
summary_en:
â€¢ Schenker has announced the 'Element 16' gaming laptop, featuring high upgradeability and repairability.
â€¢ It will be powered by an Intel Core Ultra 7 356H CPU and support up to 64GB of RAM.
â€¢ A modular design including the keyboard, port module, and motherboard allows for easy future upgrades.
content_en:
Schenker has announced the 'Element 16' gaming laptop, prioritizing upgradeability and repairability. Developed in collaboration with Intel, it is based on the latest Intel Panther Lake Core Ultra Series 3 CPU. Scheduled for release in 2026, configurations will include a Core Ultra 7 356H CPU and support up to 64GB of RAM. The Element 16â€™s key feature is its extensive customization options. In addition to commonly upgradeable components like RAM, SSD storage, fans, and the battery, the design allows tool-less access to internal parts by opening the bottom panel with minimal screws. Furthermore, the keyboard and port module are also replaceable, adopting a modular design similar to the Framework 16. Port modules are attached to the side and can be replaced collectively to modify the port configuration. While the motherboard is also replaceable, it remains unclear whether it will support both AMD and Intel CPUs. Pricing, parts availability, and the extent of parts disclosure by Schenker are yet to be announced. The laptop will be available through Bestware in the EU.

Review (EN)

Seriously impressive specs! The motherboard being replaceable is a game-changer for future upgrades. The Framework 16-style modularity is a huge win for users. Can't wait for the Bestware release!

review_en: Honestly, a major outage at a key US carrier is shocking. It highlights vulnerabilities in their communication infrastructure. Hoping for a swift recovery from Verizon and sincere compensation for customers.
title_en: Major Verizon Outage: iPhones Display 'SOS' as Communication Services Fail
summary_en:
â€¢ A major outage is impacting Verizon, leaving iPhone users unable to make calls, send SMS messages, or use data services.
â€¢ The outage causes iPhones to display 'SOS' in the status bar, indicating a loss of connection to the carrier network.
â€¢ Verizon has promised compensation to affected customers, with details to be announced later.
content_en:
Today, a major outage has occurred at Verizon, a US telecommunications carrier. As a result of this outage, iPhone users utilizing Verizon services are unable to use basic communication functions such as making calls, sending SMS messages, and using 5G/LTE data services. The display of 'SOS' in the iPhone status bar indicates a loss of connection to the carrier network, a very rare occurrence outside of emergency situations. Verizon has promised to compensate all customers affected by this outage, with specific details to be announced at a later date. Restoration efforts are currently underway around the clock, and an early recovery is anticipated.

Review (EN)

Honestly, a major outage at a key US carrier is shocking. It highlights vulnerabilities in their communication infrastructure. Hoping for a swift recovery from Verizon and sincere compensation for customers.

title_en: Major Leak: 'Forza Horizon 6' Release Date Potentially Revealed - May 19th?
summary_en:
â€¢ A pre-order popup for 'Forza Horizon 6' has been discovered within 'Forza Horizon 5'.
â€¢ The release date is suggested to be May 15th for early access and May 19th for the official launch.
â€¢ The game boasts over 550 vehicles, the most in the series, and an expansive open world.
content_en:
Today, a report by @XBOXF10 on X (formerly Twitter) revealed that a pre-order popup for 'Forza Horizon 6' has appeared within 'Forza Horizon 5'. This popup indicates early access from May 15th for four days, with an official release date of May 19th. Pre-order bonuses include two additional expansion packs, a welcome pack, VIP membership, Car Pass, and Time Attack Car Pass. Furthermore, a specially tuned Ferrari J50 will also be available. As confirmed by screenshots, the game features over 550 vehicles â€“ the most in the series â€“ and the largest open world ever seen in a Forza title. The dedication of the development team is truly evident.

Review (EN)

These specs are insane! Over 550 cars... the possibilities are endless. Can't wait to explore that massive open world. The Ferrari J50 bonus is a huge plus, and I'm definitely grabbing early access. Time to upgrade my PC!

title_en: Safari Technology Preview 235 Released: Support for macOS Sequoia/Tahoe! Get a Sneak Peek at the Next-Gen Safari
summary_en:
â€¢ Safari Technology Preview 235 has been released.
â€¢ It supports macOS Sequoia and macOS Tahoe, allowing a wide range of users to participate in testing.
â€¢ Improvements are included in key web technologies such as CSS, JavaScript, and WebAssembly.
content_en:
Apple today released the latest update, version 235, of Safari Technology Preview, its experimental browser. This preview version is designed for testing features planned for future versions of the Safari browser. The update includes fixes and improvements across a wide range of areas, including CSS, Canvas, Clipboard, Editing, Encoding, Forms, HTML, JavaScript, MathML, Media, Networking, Rendering, SVG, Web APIs, WebAssembly, and WebRTC. Notably, it now supports the latest macOS versions, Sequoia and Tahoe. This allows a larger number of developers and enthusiastic users to be among the first to test the next-generation Safari features. The update is easily installed through the system preferences or system settings software update mechanism for users who have downloaded Safari Technology Preview. Detailed release notes are available on the Safari Technology Preview website. Apple aims to collect valuable feedback from developers and users through this preview version to further evolve the Safari browser.

Review (EN)

macOS Sequoia/Tahoe support is HUGE! Excited to see WebAssembly improvements and get a first look at the next Safari. Can't wait to test the bug fixes and performance gains. Love Safari's design & usability â€“ hyped for future updates!

title_en: Robotic Revolution in Cell Therapy: Over 70% Cost Reduction to Accelerate Future Healthcare!
summary_en:
â€¢ Multiply Labs is revolutionizing cell therapy manufacturing processes by introducing robotic technology into cleanrooms.
â€¢ Achieves over 70% cost reduction compared to conventional systems, accelerating production volume.
â€¢ Increased efficiency and cost reduction in cell therapy have the potential to enable access for more patients.
content_en:
Multiply Labs, in collaboration with cell therapy companies, is bringing significant transformation to the manufacturing process of cell therapies by introducing robotic technology into cleanrooms. This innovative approach has resulted in over 70% cost reduction and a substantial acceleration of production volume compared to conventional systems. Cell therapy holds great promise for the treatment of intractable diseases, but its high manufacturing costs have hindered widespread adoption. This robotic implementation significantly reduces the cost of cell therapy, potentially enabling more patients to access this treatment. Further advancements in automation within the healthcare sector are anticipated.

Review (EN)

Over 70% cost reduction is incredible! This is a game-changer for cell therapy accessibility. Major pharma needs to jump on this â€“ the future of healthcare is here!

title_en: NVIDIA and Lilly Team Up for AI-Powered Drug Discovery: A Potential Revolution in Healthcare?
summary_en:
â€¢ NVIDIA's Jensen Huang and Lilly's Dave Ricks announced a collaboration focused on AI-driven drug discovery.
â€¢ Both companies anticipate that AI will accelerate the drug discovery process and enable more efficient development of new medicines.
â€¢ This partnership has the potential to promote the use of AI in the healthcare industry and lead to the development of groundbreaking therapies.
content_en:
NVIDIA and Lilly announced a strategic partnership focused on AI-powered drug discovery at the J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference in San Francisco. NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang and Lilly CEO Dave Ricks discussed how AI can transform the entire drug discovery process, enabling faster and more effective development of new medicines. Both companies believe that AI can streamline each stage of drug discovery, including target identification, compound design, and clinical trial optimization. Through this partnership, Lilly aims to leverage NVIDIA's AI platform and expertise to increase the speed and success rate of new drug development. This news underscores the significant impact AI is having on the healthcare industry and future developments are highly anticipated.

Review (EN)

Huge news! NVIDIA & Lilly teaming up for AI drug discovery is a game-changer. This could drastically accelerate the development of life-saving medicines. #AI #DrugDiscovery #NVIDIA #Lilly

title_en: ROG Harpe Ace Mini Core Finally Released! Surprising Price and New Features Revealed
summary_en:
â€¢ The ASUS ROG Harpe Ace Mini Core has been released on Amazon for $49.99.
â€¢ The weight has been revised to 52g from the initial announcement, and the cable is now paracord.
â€¢ It now supports ASUS Gear Link, allowing customization through a web-based driver software.
content_en:
The ASUS ROG Harpe Ace Mini Core has officially launched on Amazon for $49.99 (approximately Â¥7,878). Several revisions have been identified from the initial announcement. Specifically, the weight has increased by 3g to 52g, and the cable material is now confirmed to be paracord. Furthermore, it has been newly discovered that it supports ASUS Gear Link, a web-based driver software also featured in ASUS's latest keyboards. The polling rate remains at 1kHz and does not support the 4kHz or 8kHz offered by competing products. Other key specifications, such as the hot-swappable switch design, remain unchanged. The product is currently out of stock on Amazon, and further stock availability is anticipated.

Review (EN)

A sub-$50 ultralight mouse is insane value! Polling rate is a bit of a shame, but Gear Link support is a huge win. Definitely want one!

review_en: The Plasma Login Manager transition is HUGE! HDR multi-monitor users rejoice. QR Wi-Fi & Spectacle OCR are game-changers. Respect to the KDE team!
title_en: KDE Plasma 6.6 Public Beta: Revolutionizing Login Experience and Usability!
summary_en:
â€¢ The public beta of KDE Plasma 6.6 has been released.
â€¢ The transition from SDDM to Plasma Login Manager significantly improves multi-monitor support, HDR capabilities, and accessibility.
â€¢ Numerous convenient new features have been added, including QR code Wi-Fi connection, Spectacle OCR, and a USB portal.
content_en:
The public beta of KDE Plasma 6.6 has been released, featuring improvements to the user interface and background optimizations. A key highlight is the transition of the login manager from SDDM to Plasma Login Manager. This enhances support for multi-monitor setups and provides a more seamless experience with HDR displays. Accessibility features have also been improved, including enhanced keyboard layout switching, power profile management, and screen reader support. Furthermore, numerous new features have been added, such as custom theme saving, QR code Wi-Fi connection, OCR functionality in Spectacle, improved controller support in the KWin window manager, automatic brightness adjustment via ambient light sensors, USB device access from sandboxed apps through a USB portal, and accessibility options like slow keys on Wayland. Performance and efficiency improvements are also included, promising an overall enhanced user experience.

Review (EN)

The Plasma Login Manager transition is HUGE! HDR multi-monitor users rejoice. QR Wi-Fi & Spectacle OCR are game-changers. Respect to the KDE team!

review_en: Intel prioritizing reviews for their flagship? Huge! Performance against the Ryzen AI Max+ 395 is the key. Price will decide, but I'm already hyped!
title_en: Intel's Panther Lake-H Set to Shake Up Mobile: Review Strategy and AMD Competition Revealed!
summary_en:
â€¢ Intel is scheduled to announce its Core Ultra Series 3 mobile processor 'Panther Lake-H' on January 27th, just before CES 2026.
â€¢ Review embargo dates are staggered, with Core Ultra X9 388H-based devices allowed reviews on January 26th, and other models on the launch date of January 27th.
â€¢ The 16-core flagship model is expected to compete directly with AMD's Ryzen AI Max+ 395, with Intel aiming for a performance advantage.
content_en:
Intel has decided to announce its Core Ultra Series 3 mobile processor family, 'Panther Lake-H,' just before CES 2026. The launch date is scheduled for January 27th. This chip is designed for laptop/notebook PC and mini PC platforms. While AMD's Ryzen AI 400 series (codename 'Gorgon Point') is expected to launch a few days prior, it is merely a minor update to existing 'Strix Point' and 'Krackan Point' silicon, with no groundbreaking technology anticipated. Intel is employing a two-stage review embargo strategy, releasing reviews for Core Ultra X9 388H-based devices on January 26th, and for other Core Ultra 'Panther Lake-H' APU series models on the hardware launch date of January 27th. While this strategy appears somewhat micro-managed, it is likely prioritizing the 16-core flagship model, which is expected to compete with AMD's high-end model 'Strix Halo' (Ryzen AI Max+ 395). Sources indicate Intel is aiming to outperform AMD in terms of performance.

Review (EN)

Intel prioritizing reviews for their flagship? Huge! Performance against the Ryzen AI Max+ 395 is the key. Price will decide, but I'm already hyped!

title_en: AMD Announces Radeon AI Bundle! Revolutionizing AI Development!
summary_en:
â€¢ AMD will soon offer an AI Bundle for Radeon GPU users, consolidating essential AI tools.
â€¢ The AI Bundle will be released as an optional update to the Adrenalin driver on January 21st.
â€¢ It aims to simplify AI development and creative workflows.
content_en:
AMD has announced the upcoming release of an 'AI Bundle' as an optional update to the Adrenalin driver, designed to streamline AI development and creative workflows for Radeon GPU users. Scheduled for release on January 21st, this bundle consolidates various AI tools that previously required individual installation. This simplification is expected to lower the barrier to entry for AI-powered development and content creation, allowing a wider range of users to benefit from AI technologies. AMD will continue its efforts to maximize the potential of Radeon GPUs.

Review (EN)

Huge win for Radeon users! This AI Bundle simplifies everything. Can't wait for the Jan 21st release â€“ unlocking new creative possibilities!

title_en: Ghost Keeper Early Access Launches Soon on Steam! 'Diabolic Collaboration Program' Begins!
summary_en:
â€¢ The Early Access version of Ghost Keeper will be released on Steam on January 28th.
â€¢ Priced at $12.99 (approximately Â¥1930), it features 7 playable characters and 6 unique locations.
â€¢ The development team aims for continuous development, actively incorporating player feedback.
content_en:
The Early Access release of Ghost Keeper on Steam has been announced for January 28th. The game will be priced at $12.99, equivalent to approximately Â¥1930 at the current exchange rate. Players will be able to control seven characters and explore six unique locations. Furthermore, the inclusion of a sandbox mode promises a high degree of freedom in gameplay. The development team intends to actively collect player feedback from this Early Access version and continue expanding the maps, characters, and story. They are referring to this collaborative development process with players as the 'Diabolic Collaboration Program,' generating significant anticipation for future updates.

Seriously, 7 characters & 6 maps for Â¥1930 in Early Access is a steal! The sandbox mode looks promising, and the dev's commitment to player feedback is awesome. This one's definitely on my radar!

title_en: Ryzen 7 9850X3D Launch Date Confirmed! Next-Gen Gaming CPU Finally Revealed!
summary_en:
â€¢ The launch date for the AMD Ryzen 7 9850X3D has been set to January 29th.
â€¢ It features the 'Granite Ridge' architecture, offering 8 cores, 16 threads, and a boost clock speed of up to 5.6GHz.
â€¢ Equipped with 104MB of 3D V-Cache and a TDP of 120W. Pricing is expected to be approximately $70 higher than the Ryzen 7 9800X3D.
content_en:
The launch date for the next-generation AMD Ryzen 7 9850X3D CPU has been confirmed as January 29th by French online retailer LDLC. This CPU is based on the latest 'Granite Ridge' architecture, featuring an 8-core, 16-thread configuration with base and boost clock speeds of 4.7GHz and 5.6GHz respectively. A key highlight is its massive 104MB of 3D V-Cache, which is expected to significantly enhance gaming performance. The TDP is rated at 120W, offering high performance with relatively low power consumption. While the official price is yet to be announced, previous inaccurate listings suggest a price point approximately $70 higher than the Ryzen 7 9800X3D. A sales embargo is in place prior to launch, and pre-orders will not be available even after reviews are published. This information aligns with previous leaks, indicating a high degree of reliability.

Review (EN)

Honestly, these specs are incredible! The combination of the Zen 5 architecture and massive 3D V-Cache has the potential to revolutionize gaming performance. Price is key, but if it's around the predicted price, I'll definitely be considering a purchase. Super excited!

review_en: Glad to see the Final Cut Pro buyout option remains! No feature changes for Logic Pro is reassuring. Slightly worried about future 'Intelligent' features being subscription-only, though. Apple's strategy seems to be encouraging subscriptions while still offering creators choices.
title_en: Future of Final Cut Pro Buyout Version: Feature Differences Revealed! Apple's Strategy Unveiled!
summary_en:
â€¢ The Final Cut Pro buyout version (USD 299.99) will continue to be offered.
â€¢ New features such as Visual Search, Transcript Search, and Beat Detection will be available on both versions.
â€¢ Some future 'Intelligent' features may be exclusive to the subscription version.
content_en:
In an interview with CineD, Apple confirmed that the Final Cut Pro for Mac buyout version (USD 299.99, approximately JPY 47,341 at current exchange rates) will continue to be offered. The newly introduced 'Intelligent' features â€“ Visual Search, Transcript Search, and Beat Detection â€“ will be available on both the buyout and Apple Creator Studio versions. However, Apple refrained from specifying whether all future 'Intelligent' features will be consistent across both versions. Furthermore, access to certain 'premium content' will be restricted for the buyout version. Regarding Logic Pro and MainStage, there will be no functional differences between the subscription and buyout versions. Conversely, other apps like Pixelmator Pro, Keynote, Numbers, Pages, and Freeform will feature 'Intelligent' functions exclusive to the subscription version. Overall, the introduction of Apple Creator Studio has resulted in a loss of feature parity, leading to dissatisfaction among users who prefer not to subscribe. This announcement suggests that Apple is gradually transitioning towards a subscription-based model.

Review (EN)

Glad to see the Final Cut Pro buyout option remains! No feature changes for Logic Pro is reassuring. Slightly worried about future 'Intelligent' features being subscription-only, though. Apple's strategy seems to be encouraging subscriptions while still offering creators choices.

review_en: Wow, DDR3 making a comeback is unexpected! Memory prices are hurting, but this is a great option for those with 6th/9th gen CPUs. Limited supply is a concern, but it's awesome to see classic hardware shine again!
title_en: DDR3 Memory Makes a Comeback! A Surprising Trend Against Rising DDR4/5 Prices
summary_en:
â€¢ The DDR3 platform is regaining attention due to the soaring prices of DDR4/DDR5 memory.
â€¢ Popularity of Intel 6th/9th generation CPUs is resurging, leading to increased sales of DDR3 motherboards.
â€¢ DDR3, once considered obsolete, is being re-evaluated due to the current memory shortage.
content_en:
Currently, DDR4 and DDR5 RAM prices are experiencing an abnormal surge, resulting in renewed attention to the DDR3 platform. Specifically, combinations with Intel 6th and 9th generation CPUs are gaining popularity, and sales of DDR3 motherboards have significantly increased. The severe memory shortage sweeping the market and the re-evaluation of DDR3, once considered obsolete, suggests that the current PC market is experiencing a return to the past. This situation implies that the DDR3 platform can be an attractive option for users looking to minimize their budget. However, it's important to note that DDR3 is no longer in production, so supply is limited.

Review (EN)

Wow, DDR3 making a comeback is unexpected! Memory prices are hurting, but this is a great option for those with 6th/9th gen CPUs. Limited supply is a concern, but it's awesome to see classic hardware shine again!

â€¢ MSI has announced the 'Roamii BE Pro' mesh Wi-Fi system, featuring the latest Wi-Fi 7 technology.
â€¢ Tri-band support, MLO, and 4K-QAM deliver ultra-low latency and a stable connection.
â€¢ Equipped with 24/7 security protection by FortiSecu and content filtering for children.
content_en:
MSI has announced the 'Roamii BE Pro Wi-Fi 7 Mesh System,' designed to provide seamless and high-speed connectivity for modern homes. The system boasts a design that balances performance and aesthetics, enabling smooth streaming, gaming, and smart home experiences throughout the house. Featuring the latest Wi-Fi 7 technology, combined with tri-band support, Multi-Link Operation (MLO), and advanced features like 4K-QAM, it delivers ultra-low latency and exceptional stability. Furthermore, MSIâ€™s proprietary FortiSecu security feature provides 24/7 protection for all connected devices, and a content filter is included to ensure the online safety of children. This allows users to enjoy a secure internet environment with peace of mind.

Wow, MSI entering the Wi-Fi 7 mesh game is HUGE! Tri-band + FortiSecu = a dream for security & performance. Low latency for gaming? Take my money!

title_en: Breaking: NVIDIA Next-Gen Arm SoC 'N1X' Potentially Found in Dell XPS 16 Premium!
summary_en:
â€¢ Shipment documents for the Dell XPS 16 Premium model reveal the potential inclusion of NVIDIA's unannounced Arm-based SoC, 'N1X ES2'.
â€¢ The 'N1X' is based on the 'Grace Blackwell' APU, also found in NVIDIA's DGX Spark, and features a 20-core Arm CPU and an iGPU with 48 Compute Units.
â€¢ Originally anticipated for announcement at CES 2026, the release is now expected in the latter half of 2026, potentially significantly impacting the Arm-based Windows PC market.
content_en:
Shipment documents pertaining to the Dell XPS 16 Premium model have revealed the potential inclusion of an unannounced NVIDIA SoC, designated 'N1X ES2'. This 'N1X' is reportedly based on the 'Grace Blackwell' APU, also utilized in NVIDIA's high-performance AI mini-desktop PC, the DGX Spark. It is said to feature a 20-core Arm CPU and an integrated GPU (iGPU) with 48 Compute Units. While an announcement was initially anticipated at CES 2026, it did not materialize, and the release is now projected for the latter half of 2026. The 'ES2' designation in the shipment documents suggests that Dell is currently testing engineering samples of the N1X. Given the current landscape where Qualcomm's Snapdragon X chips power Windows 11 Arm with Copilot+, the arrival of the N1X has the potential to significantly disrupt the Arm-based Windows PC market. Should the XPS 16 Premium with this SoC be released, substantial advancements in both performance and power efficiency are expected.

Review (EN)

Seriously impressive specs! A 20-core Arm CPU and 48CU iGPU could redefine mobile PC performance. NVIDIA's tech is just incredible. Price will be key, but I'm definitely interested if it's reasonable.

review_en: The growth of AI demand is exceeding expectations! This server CPU price hike will significantly impact datacenter operating costs. Hyperscaler stockpiling makes sense, but I'm concerned about the impact on smaller businesses. Faster CPUs are great, but the price is a major hurdle.
title_en: Potential Server CPU Price Hike: Intel and AMD Consider Price Increases Amidst AI Demand
summary_en:
â€¢ AMD and Intel are reportedly considering raising server CPU prices by up to 15%.
â€¢ The surge in AI demand, particularly the migration to the latest generation CPUs by hyperscalers, is the primary driver of the potential price increase.
â€¢ Server CPU inventory is already sold out, suggesting prices may remain elevated for some time.
content_en:
Reports indicate that both AMD and Intel are considering raising server CPU prices by up to 15%. This is driven by a surge in demand for AI, with hyperscalers actively transitioning to the latest generation of server CPUs, creating supply constraints. Both companies have already sold out of their server CPU inventory for the current fiscal year, making a short-term price decrease unlikely. This price increase will directly impact server operating costs and may indirectly affect the PC DIY market. Further developments will be closely monitored.

Review (EN)

The growth of AI demand is exceeding expectations! This server CPU price hike will significantly impact datacenter operating costs. Hyperscaler stockpiling makes sense, but I'm concerned about the impact on smaller businesses. Faster CPUs are great, but the price is a major hurdle.

review_en: This situation is deeply concerning. A studio closure so soon after unionization raises serious questions about Ubisoft's motives. Urgent improvements to labor conditions in the gaming industry are needed!
title_en: Ubisoft Halifax Closure & Union Dispute: Legal Battle Begins!
summary_en:
â€¢ Ubisoft Halifax studio was closed just three weeks after a unionization vote.
â€¢ CWA Canada is suing Ubisoft on behalf of all 71 employees who were laid off.
â€¢ Ubisoft claims the closure is unrelated to the unionization effort, but the union suspects a rights violation.
content_en:
In December 2025, Ubisoft Halifax studio held a unionization vote with CWA Canada, resulting in 61 out of 71 employees joining Local 30111. However, just three weeks later, Ubisoft announced the studio's closure and the layoff of all 71 employees. Ubisoft maintains that the closure is unrelated to the unionization effort. CWA Canada has stated it will pursue all legal avenues to protect workers' rights and has initiated that process. Concerns have been raised regarding the studio receiving tax subsidies shortly before the closure, and the possibility that the unionization effort directly led to the layoffs. The outcome of the ensuing legal battle will be closely watched.

Review (EN)

This situation is deeply concerning. A studio closure so soon after unionization raises serious questions about Ubisoft's motives. Urgent improvements to labor conditions in the gaming industry are needed!

review_en: This spec is incredible! The combination of Xeon Granite Rapids-WS and Grace Blackwell has the potential to dramatically boost workstation performance. I'm also very curious about the benefits of the EBB format. Definitely a contender if the price is right!
title_en: ASUS Announces Next-Gen Workstation Motherboard! Supports Xeon Granite Rapids-WS & Grace Blackwell!
summary_en:
â€¢ ASUS has announced its next-generation workstation motherboard at CES 2026.
â€¢ It features an LGA 4710 socket supporting the Intel Xeon "Granite Rapids-WS" processor family.
â€¢ Integration with the NVIDIA GB300 "Grace Blackwell" superchip is suggested.
content_en:
Following the conclusion of CES 2026, ASUS announced a new workstation motherboard via social media. This product is characterized by its adoption of the EBB format, designed to deliver high performance and stability for professional users. The showcased sample was displayed on a black pedestal bearing the ASUS logo and the slogan â€œin search of incredible.â€ While detailed specifications remain unknown at this time, it has been confirmed that the motherboard features an LGA 4710 socket supporting the Intel Xeon "Granite Rapids-WS" processor family. Furthermore, integration with the NVIDIA GB300 "Grace Blackwell" superchip, as seen in the ExpertCenter Pro ET900N G3 workstation, is suggested, generating significant anticipation for future developments. This new motherboard is potentially a successor to the existing Pro WS W790E-SAGE SE.

Review (EN)

This spec is incredible! The combination of Xeon Granite Rapids-WS and Grace Blackwell has the potential to dramatically boost workstation performance. I'm also very curious about the benefits of the EBB format. Definitely a contender if the price is right!

review_en: Huge props to Nintendo, Sony, and Microsoft for prioritizing player safety! This collaboration is a game-changer for the industry. ğŸ®ğŸ›¡ï¸
title_en: Nintendo, Sony, and Microsoft Strengthen Collaboration to Enhance Gaming Platform Safety!
summary_en:
â€¢ Nintendo, Sony Interactive Entertainment, and Microsoft have announced continued collaboration to improve player safety.
â€¢ The focus is on the positive aspects of the gaming experience, with increased consideration for younger players.
â€¢ A multifaceted approach combining technology, research, community activities, and human monitoring is being adopted to address evolving safety measures.
content_en:
Nintendo, Sony Interactive Entertainment, and Microsoft have announced the continuation of their collaborative efforts to enhance player safety across their respective platforms. This collaboration is rooted in a shared goal: ensuring that gaming is an enjoyable experience for everyone, particularly providing a positive and safe environment for younger players. Since the initial commitment in 2020, these companies have strengthened safety measures through a multifaceted approach integrating advanced technology, research-based insights, supportive community initiatives, and skilled human moderation. The latest shared principles reflect new innovations in player safety evolving with technological advancements and methods for collaborating with key industry initiatives. This partnership represents a significant step towards building a safer environment throughout the gaming industry.

Review (EN)

Huge props to Nintendo, Sony, and Microsoft for prioritizing player safety! This collaboration is a game-changer for the industry. ğŸ®ğŸ›¡ï¸

Last year, Microsoft laid off 9,000+ people across the entire company, including its gaming division. The layoffs saw studios like The Initiative entirely shut down, while others like ZeniMax Online, King, and Rare were hit by major cuts and project cancellations. At the time of the layoffs, former and current ZeniMax workers aptly called the cuts "inhumane" and "disgusting," so it's uplifting to see yet another studio rise up out of these cuts, as former ZeniMax developers have come together to form a new studio, Ironroot Games. Ironroot Games is the second studio to specifically come from former ZeniMax Online […]

title: Ubisoft Layoffs Reportedly Continue at Growtopia Studio, Ubisoft Abu Dhabi
summary: ï¼ˆAIåˆ¶é™ä¸­ã®ãŸã‚åŸæ–‡ï¼‰ Ubisoft is starting 2026 in a similar fashion to how it started 2025. The Assassin's Creed company s...

Ubisoft is starting 2026 in a similar fashion to how it started 2025. The Assassin's Creed company shut down its Leamington-based studio in January 2025, laying off 185 people. To start 2026, between the shuttering of Ubisoft Halifax and yesterday's layoffs at Massive Entertainment and Ubisoft Stockholm, Ubisoft has already laid off an estimated 126 developers. Now, that number is definitely a little higher, as a new report from Game Developer reveals layoffs have continued at Ubisoft Abu Dhabi. According to the report, cuts at the Abu Dhabi studio began back in December 2025 and have continued into the new […]

title: ã€ç¿»è¨³å¤±æ•—ã€‘(PR) BIOSTAR Unveils Two New EdgeComp Nano Series IPCs
summary: AIç”Ÿæˆã«å¤±æ•—ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚
content: BIOSTAR, a leading manufacturer of edge computing solutions, industrial motherboards, graphics cards, and storage devices, today announces a refined dual-track edge computing strategy for its EdgeComp industrial computing portfolio, addressing the evolving demands of IoT deployments and edge AI applications. As edge computing adoption accelerates across industrial automation, smart infrastructure, and intelligent systems, market requirements have become increasingly segmented. IoT deployments often prioritize compact design, low power consumption, and long-term stability, while edge AI applications demand significantly higher compute performance and real-time processing capability. Recognizing these distinct requirements, BIOSTAR has formalized its EdgeComp portfolio around a clear dual-track approach, enabling system integrators and solution providers to deploy purpose-built platforms tailored to specific application needs. title: Flagship Intel Xeon 698X "Granite Rapids-WS" with 86 Cores and 336 MB L3 Cache Appears
summary: ï¼ˆAIåˆ¶é™ä¸­ã®ãŸã‚åŸæ–‡ï¼‰ Intel's flagship "Granite Rapids-WS" processor has appeared on Geekbench, confirming the s...
content:
â€»APIåˆ¶é™ã®ãŸã‚åŸæ–‡ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™

Intel's flagship "Granite Rapids-WS" processor has appeared on Geekbench, confirming the specifications that will power Intel's HEDT platform for the upcoming year. The tested model is a Xeon 698X CPU, featuring 86 cores and 172 threads, with a base frequency of 2.0 GHz and a boost frequency of 4.6 GHz. With 86 cores, it is unclear whether this boost frequency applies to all cores or only select ones. Nonetheless, the CPU achieved a score of 2,532 points in the single-core test and 21,030 points in the multicore test on Geekbench v6.5, running on the Ubuntu 24.04.3 LTS operating system. This CPU SKU also includes an impressive 336 MB of L3 cache. Built on Intel's XCC server compute dies, the design likely involves a multi-chip-module SoC working together to achieve the high core count. These specifications are not yet public, so the exact die configuration will be revealed when the platform launches. For the W890 workstation platform hosting these CPUs, Intel has chosen a socket E2 design with 4,710 LGA pins, capable of supporting TDP ratings up to 350 watts. Intel is adopting a two-tier approach with distinct "Expert" and "Mainstream" configurations. The Expert-class offers 112 PCIe lanes (96 PCIe 5.0 lanes plus 16 PCIe 4.0 lanes), while the Mainstream tier provides 80 PCIe 5.0 lanes. As for pricing, these CPUs are expected to be expensive. Earlier listings indicated that the lineup peaks at a price point of $8,300 for the flagship Xeon 698X SK

title: Steam Breaks 42 Million Concurrent Players, New All-Time High
summary: ï¼ˆAIåˆ¶é™ä¸­ã®ãŸã‚åŸæ–‡ï¼‰ Valve's Steam platform is a staple of PC gaming, and its influence continues to grow to this day. Ac...
content:
â€»APIåˆ¶é™ã®ãŸã‚åŸæ–‡ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™

Valve's Steam platform is a staple of PC gaming, and its influence continues to grow to this day. According to SteamDB data shared on X, the Steam platform reached an impressive 42 million concurrent players on January 11, at around 14:00 UTC. This represents a new all-time high for the platform, which has broken countless records in the past. Interestingly, one might expect this record to occur during the holiday season when most people have extra time to play. However, it seems that the number of gamers on Steam is increasing even during regular times. Several factors could be contributing to this, including gamers trying out new hardware purchased during the holiday season, seeking discounts, or simply browsing the platform to see if anything interesting is happening. At the same time, the number of players in-game was recorded at 13.12 million active gamers, meaning the rest were using the platform to browse, chat, or perhaps do some game shopping. Nonetheless, 42 million concurrent Steam users is a massive achievement. Perhaps when Valve starts rolling out its Steam Machine, more concurrent players will be present, as that will likely increase the number by a few tens of thousands. Third-party SteamOS integration could also help, but we will need to wait and see how Valve handles that.
